page.title: 14HONING OUTDOOR RECREATION
page.content: In our area there are opportunities for coarse fishing,horse riding, bird watching and rambling. There are no theatres, cinemas, public tennis courts,golf courses and supermarkets. The rarest bird to be seen in the area is the golden oriole. Kingfishers live along the drain banks and streams. Green woodpeckers live in the trees and spotted woodpeckers amongst the gorse.Weavers Way is a disused railway which is now part of Norfolk's long distance footpath network.The stretch that enters our area startsmat Stalham and leads to Nth.Walsham.It was an M&GN railway,and the brickwork of the waiting rooms and platforms at Honing station is still visible. The Nth.Walsham/Dilham canal is not used as such now, but canoeists are able to navigate parts of its shallow course.
